page.title: 04Wormleighton The Village
page.content: To visit is to step back in time - apart from six cottages the village is owned by Earl Spencer. It consists of a row of estate cottages with large front gardens, mostly well cared for. The Manor House and Gatehouse are still lived in but the old house adjacent to the gatehouse is unoccupied and with a hole in the roof will soon fall into disrepair. The old schoolhouse still stands but not for thirtyfive years has it been used for teaching due to lack of pupils. It has been given to the village and is now used as a village hall. Similarly the one shop in the village, the post office has closed. There is remaining a telephone kiosk and a postbox. One new bungalow has been built on the hillside and three cottages have been made into one and sold.
